summary_text: The authorsâ aim is to consider the problem of question focused sentence retrieval from complex news
articles describing multi-event stories published over time.
Annotators generated a list of questions
central to understanding each story in our corpus.
Recent work has motivated the need for systems
that support âInformation Synthesisâ tasks, in which a user seeks a global understanding of a topic or
The specific problem they consider differs from the classic task of PR for a Q&A system in
interesting ways, due to the time-sensitive nature of the stories in our corpus.

this end, they propose to use a stochastic, graph-based method.

During the task, they have shown that over a
large set of unaltered questions written by their annotators, LexRank can, on average, outperform the
